New Records: Taijuan Walker is the first Phillies pitcher to allow 13 or more hits without a strikeout since Blix Donnelly on April 28, 1948.
The 13 hits allowed by Taijuan Walker were the most by a Phillies pitcher since Aaron Harang allowed 14 in five innings on July 1, 2015.
Taijuan Walker is the first Phillies pitcher to not record a strikeout while pitching at least six innings since Ben Lively on June 3, 2017.
Key Match Events: Taijuan Walker allowed 13 hits, six runs, one walk, and one home run in six innings against the Astros.
Walker allowed five of those runs in the fourth inning.
The Phillies lost the game 10-0 to the Astros.
Post-Match Reflections: Taijuan Walker expressed his determination to keep going despite his struggles, stating, 'I feel good about myself. I feel confident in myself. Obviously, I want to keep going and keep working through it.'
Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on Walker's performance, saying, 'There was not much swing-and-miss. And he needs to be swing and miss.'
Rob Thomson also reflected on Walker's effort, stating, 'I feel bad for him. I really do. Because I think all of you know how much I respect and love the players. And he works extremely hard.'
Others: The Phillies are considering moving Taijuan Walker to the bullpen or designating him for assignment due to his recent performance struggles.
Rosters expand from 26 to 28 players on Sunday, which could impact Walker's role.
Right-hander Tyler Phillips and left-hander Kolby Allard are potential candidates to replace Walker in the rotation.
